summary: This is a memorandum and order by Judge Loretta A. Preska denying Ghislaine Maxwell's request for reconsideration of the court's July 23, 2020 decision to unseal her deposition transcript and that of 'Doe 1'. The court rejects Maxwell's argument that her recent indictment and arrest constitute new grounds for keeping the depositions sealed, finding the issue was already considered. The order includes a brief stay to allow Maxwell to appeal.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the civil case who filed a letter requesting reconsideration of the court's decision to unseal her deposition transcript and that of Doe 1. She was indicted and arrested in July 2020.

persons.name: Loretta A. Preska
persons.context: The judge who authored this memorandum and order, denying Maxwell's request for reconsideration and ordering the unsealing of deposition transcripts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the central figure in ongoing criminal investigations, with Maxwell being described as one of the 'unknown individuals associated' with him.

persons.name: Doe 1
persons.context: An anonymous individual whose deposition transcript is also subject to the unsealing order alongside Maxwell's.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as one of the 'unknown individuals associated with Jeffrey Epstein' in the context of ongoing criminal investigations.
Both are deponents in the same civil case, and their deposition transcripts are being unsealed together per the court's order.
Judge Preska is presiding over the civil case and ruling on Maxwell's motion for reconsideration regarding the unsealing of deposition transcripts.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested, as noted by the court in relation to her request for reconsideration.

events.title: Court Decision to Unseal Depositions
events.description: Judge Preska issued a decision to unseal the deposition transcripts of Ghislaine Maxwell and Doe 1, as well as related court submissions.

events.title: Denial of Reconsideration and Stay Order
events.description: Judge Preska denied Maxwell's request for reconsideration of the unsealing decision but stayed the unsealing for two business days to allow for an appeal.

events.title: Scheduled Unsealing of Deposition Transcripts
events.description: The scheduled date for the unsealing of Maxwell's and Doe 1's deposition transcripts and related materials, subject to any stay from the Court of Appeals.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Judge Loretta A. Preska denied Ghislaine Maxwell's last-minute request to reconsider the unsealing of her deposition transcript and that of an anonymous witness (Doe 1).

The court found Maxwell's argument—that her July 2020 indictment and arrest were new developments justifying secrecy—was not new, as the potential for her criminal liability was already implied in earlier filings.
The court ordered a brief stay of the unsealing until August 3, 2020, solely to allow Maxwell time to seek an emergency stay from the Court of Appeals.
The document references ongoing criminal investigations into individuals associated with Jeffrey Epstein, explicitly grouping Maxwell among them.
The ruling reinforces the presumption of public access to court records, weighing it against Maxwell's concerns about influencing witnesses or victims.
